data.fullContent: The Kepler conjecture is a mathematical conjecture, about Sphere packing in three-dimensional Euclidean space. It is named after Johannes Kepler ( 1571-1630 ) who first had this idea. Kepler supposed that the ways to pack spheres of equal size that result in the packing with the highest density are face-centered cubic or hexagonal packings. These packings have a density of slightly over 74 percent, this means that they fill about 74 percent of space available.
data.answer: 开普勒猜想是一个数学猜想，关于三维欧几里得空间中球体的堆积。开普勒(Johannes Kepler, 1571-1630)是第一个有这个想法的人。开普勒认为，将大小相同的球体包装成密度最高的球体的方法是面心立方或六边形包装。这些填料的密度略高于74%，这意味着它们占据了可用空间的74%。
